title: So going off League Of Legends boasting 100,000,000 active players (Item sets post)
body:
http://www.riftherald.com/2016/9/13/12865314/monthly-lol-players-2016-active-worldwide


Riot said only 1% of players use the feature.

(intense math)

1% of 100,000,000 is 1,000,000

If they made improvements to item sets then it'd be well over 1%

But even if they didn't...


Is 1,000,000 people not enough to keep this feature for? Riot you say 1% like it's a small number but think about how much that actually is.

(That's more than a lot of games even have as active players)


It's clear this feature is wanted (And I bet you some people don't even know it exists).

replies.body: I used to use it. Then it was buggy as hell. Never saved. Pretty much just gave up on it.

Just so it's clear, it doesn't seem like there is 100 million separate people, it's probably a lot of smurfs being counted in that, because that article makes it very clear that the DotA players are unique, while League doesn't (meaning the league base probably hasn't grown much at all.)
